intro: Trianthella glutinosa, commonly known as sticky trianthella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, sticky leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Trianthella glutinosa is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils.
